title: Question:
author: btcswimmer
content: What's your favourite cryptocurrency besides Bitcoin?Maybe Monero, with its privacy, scalability and fair mining?Ethereum, with its innovative smart contracts?Maybe Litecoin, the old and trusted low-fee coin?Or Bitcoin Cash, which tries to follow Satoshi's vision?Or, why not, Dogecoin, the funny coin?Pick your favourite and reply here why you love it!

comments.author: Alone055
comments.body: You didn't need to create a new thread to discuss something when the same thing is being discussed already in a previously created thread.Here is the thread: What's your Favorite Altcoin and Why? created by BitcoinBarrel

comments.author: Makus
comments.body: Op what you did is spamming and it has a negative effect on you account, which could lead to neutral tag or negative tag, I will advise you lock this thread and do enough reading and study about this forum at the beginners and help board, there you will find some threads that will enlighten you on how the forum works including the do and donts of this great forum so you learn to become a better poster and a good contributor to this forum to avoid your account from being busted. I can see your account was created not quite long, so it will not be giving much chances before reporting it for spamming, hope you take my advise and save yourself the shame of having a bad reputation.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: OP, as other members have pointed out, you made a new topic about something that is already being talked about in another thread. I get wanting to add your voice, but making a whole new thread can come across as spammy. It is better to join the existing conversation instead. No biggie, just something to keep in mind going forward and  lets lock this one up and head over to the other thread.

comments.author: nelson4lov
comments.body: My favorite is Ethereum. This is die to the fact that ethereum made available, the first open source and public turing complete system for blockchains which solved an inherent problem with Bitcoin — which is the ability to write native applications on top of bitcoin. As someone who writes and reads solidity code and have played around with the EVM and other nitty gritty details of the technology, it is easily my most loved crypto (Bitcoin is #1). Ethereum pioneered the development of at least 80% of the top 100 cryptos right now on coinmarketcap since all of those are either EVM-based, an improvement to EVM, L1, L2, etc.

comments.author: DaNNy001
comments.body: Quote from: Alone055 on November 09, 2023, 08:36:39 PMYou didn't need to create a new thread to discuss something when the same thing is being discussed already in a previously created thread.Here is the thread: What's your Favorite Altcoin and Why? created by BitcoinBarrelAt first seeing this particular topic, I thought it was same topic but I later reliaze that it's actually a now one and would like to point that this particular one isn't all that needed. But with being said, I think my reply will still be that I don't have a particular altcoins which I will point out as my favorite but if their is any I would grade different against other altcoins would be the Ethereum coins as it has gain a name for itself in the crypto Market.

comments.author: Cryptoababe
comments.body: I don't have favourite altcoin. I frequently check low cap altcoins more than any of these coins you listed like they are my favourite especially when i invest in any. Although, I pair ETH with most of my coins on Bitget smart portfolio which I use to Balance my holdings but I do that because its the strongest among them not because I like it more.

comments.author: Samlucky O
comments.body: Quote from: Alone055 on November 09, 2023, 08:36:39 PMYou didn't need to create a new thread to discuss something when the same thing is being discussed already in a previously created thread.Here is the thread: What's your Favorite Altcoin and Why? created by BitcoinBarrelI was also thinking as much. These has been posted here already so no need to duplicate several related topic but to concentrate on a particular one and make it more attractive.There are thousands of alrcoin out dere. But depending on the individual different. Despite the low quality review of Many people on altcoin I think there are still useful ones with great future like I said before BNB is a good altcoin because it has been funtioning as a fuel in many wallet, meaning it serves as a transaction fee in coin swapping as smart contract.

comments.author: BitHeir
comments.body: My favorite altcoin is Terra Classic LUNC. There are efforts from Terra Classic community to burn the token and reduce its total supply.https://www.luncmetrics.com/It's about 1% of its total supply has been burned since May 2022 when the Terra LUNA crash.

comments.author: Zigabel
comments.body: Doge coin has been my favorite meme coin for quiet a long period of time because of how well I have benefited from dodge coin, few years back I bought dodge coin, that was in 2020 I left it for two years and back in 2022 I sol off and I made a very good profit from it and since then I've always gat my eyes on doge and have gotten to love it as one of my favorites meme coins. So basically the profit I got hodling doge had made me developed that love for dodge coin.

comments.author: Sayeds56
comments.body: Quote from: btcswimmer on November 09, 2023, 06:08:31 PMWhat's your favourite cryptocurrency besides Bitcoin?Maybe Monero, with its privacy, scalability and fair mining?Ethereum, with its innovative smart contracts?Maybe Litecoin, the old and trusted low-fee coin?Or Bitcoin Cash, which tries to follow Satoshi's vision?Or, why not, Dogecoin, the funny coin?Pick your favourite and reply here why you love it!My most favorite coin has been since it was launched in 2017 and I used to trade in around its price hovered $30. The reasons I likr it most is its strong and robust use case, unrivaled by any other altcoin. It is the leading coin of alts market because its network is utilized for deploying smart contracts, creating dApps, digital arts (NFTs) and many mores. The problem with Ethereum network is its comparatively high transaction fees, which is likely to come down after upcoming upgrades.

comments.author: Bushdark
comments.body: Quote from: Zigabel on November 10, 2023, 09:03:44 AMDoge coin has been my favorite meme coin for quiet a long period of time because of how well I have benefited from dodge coin, few years back I bought dodge coin, that was in 2020 I left it for two years and back in 2022 I sol off and I made a very good profit from it and since then I've always gat my eyes on doge and have gotten to love it as one of my favorites meme coins. So basically the profit I got hodling doge had made me developed that love for dodge coin.There are also new coins in the market we can make a lot of profits from if we are ready to hold. There are plenty meme coin in the market now juts like Pepe, Memeland and other we can keep our eyes on buying and accumulating as much as we can so thatbwe can make good profits from our portfolio of meme coins when the bull market we had been waiting for finally comes. Meme coins can give us some good profits if we know how to identify good meme coins that are being launched in the market.

comments.author: Sayeds56
comments.body: Quote from: Bushdark on November 10, 2023, 11:58:34 AMThere are also new coins in the market we can make a lot of profits from if we are ready to hold. There are plenty meme coin in the market now juts like Pepe, Memeland and other we can keep our eyes on buying and accumulating as much as we can so thatbwe can make good profits from our portfolio of meme coins when the bull market we had been waiting for finally comes. Meme coins can give us some good profits if we know how to identify good meme coins that are being launched in the market. You are absolutely right, there are lot of other. coins in meme coins sector those can potentially yield good profit in the bull market, such as meme, floki and shiba inu. However, there is prevalent perception  that meme coins are generally associated with pump and dump schemes, as they are primarily used for fun purpose. In stead, I would recommend to invest in those alt coins which have strong use case, such as Ethereum, Chain Link, Solana and Dot.

comments.author: VFalcon
comments.body: From this list now Solana))) it has already given me x2, if we talk about long-term profit, it is probably TFS, with its APY you can live comfortably

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: Ethereum without a doubt. It's not about being the favorite actually, it's just about relying on what it will bring in the future, money-wise. It's the top altcoin for a reason and because of that many investors will keep on going back to Ethereum and purchase it making the demand soar to a number that is unexpected. Just like now, it's back to Over $2000 again and it will keep on rising while the best cryptocurrency is also going up. Bitcoin. I think that Ethereum will always be the wiser choice when it comes to investing in cryptocurrency and we should stop wasting time looking for a gem that is like a needle in the haystack. It's a waste of time, money, and effort, we will just keep on hurting our wallets by buying different coins that won't really give something back in the future. Ethereum on the other hand, just needs patience because it's going upwards no matter what. There will be dumps because it's part of how the market behaves but it's still going up after that.

comments.author: Sophokles
comments.body: From the list it is ETH and Polygon. ETH for being more resilient with its adoption and user growth. There were some projects that had community support but they failed to keep that community intact. That community splintered in several other project and the original project lost its cause. ETH shows its performance, growth and adoptive nature in any market demand.Polygon I like industrial-grade highly scalable blockchains. It has a massive community, low gas fees and support from the main ethereum community. The most important part is that they have the support of big companies that they have partnerships with.

comments.body: Quote from: danherbias07 on November 10, 2023, 02:25:29 PMEthereum without a doubt. It's not about being the favorite actually, it's just about relying on what it will bring in the future, money-wise. It's the top altcoin for a reason and because of that many investors will keep on going back to Ethereum and purchase it making the demand soar to a number that is unexpected. I think that Ethereum will always be the wiser choice when it comes to investing in cryptocurrency and we should stop wasting time looking for a gem that is like a needle in the haystack. It's a waste of time, money, and effort, we will just keep on hurting our wallets by buying different coins that won't really give something back in the future. Ethereum on the other hand, just needs patience because it's going upwards no matter what. There will be dumps because it's part of how the market behaves but it's still going up after that.ETH has always been the second best alternative coin after Bitcoin to invest because they really have benefits that can make everyone benefit each cycle, apart from what you express the other few sentiments from the development of ETH is also planned to make the same ETF submission as Bitcoin ETF , of course this will be a bullish sentiment for the development of ETH prices in the future with its advanced technology.Quote from: Sophokles on November 10, 2023, 04:02:04 PMFrom the list it is ETH and Polygon. ETH for being more resilient with its adoption and user growth. There were some projects that had community support but they failed to keep that community intact. That community splintered in several other project and the original project lost its cause. ETH shows its performance, growth and adoptive nature in any market demand.Polygon I like industrial-grade highly scalable blockchains. It has a massive community, low gas fees and support from the main ethereum community. The most important part is that they have the support of big companies that they have partnerships with.I also like polygon because they do a pretty good development for scalability and transaction costs, as well as other things they update for the development of their ecosystems, I have heard that polygon/matic will change its name to pol with the latest proposal in which there is an integration of progress Polygon network.​

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Well for me its Bnb cause Ive seen it grow and have a lot of use case on their website. I personally like launchpad and launchpool where you can have access to new tokens on the market by staking your bnb. Of course you need a lot to gain a lot. Also the fees are save when you have bnb and used it for payment. There are also other altcoins that I like but this is on the top of my list.

The most important part is that they have the support of big companies that they have partnerships with.I also like polygon because they do a pretty good development for scalability and transaction costs, as well as other things they update for the development of their ecosystems, I have heard that polygon/matic will change its name to pol with the latest proposal in which there is an integration of progress Polygon network.​Not only the name matic is changing its whole business model. Now the POL token will power its entire native chain. It has different chains for different purposes but now all of its chains will be connected through a POL token and the community will be able to participate in all the chain consensus by staking only one token. This seems cool to me and correct me if i made any mistake understand the whole thing.

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: I voted ltc but monero, eth, doge are too my favorite alts. Doge is for the lulz (cheap too), ltc is cheap and wellknown, xmr is good for staying anonymous, eth is cool because smart contracts and shiet. There are other good alts too in your list but I think eth, ltc, doge and xmr are the best ones overall. Bnb for example can’t survive without binance. It is a good alt as long as binance is operational but the moment binance goes down, bnb will go down with it and I don’t like to bet on binance’s well being. I would rather hold a decentralized project like ltc instead. Binance or any other exchange may go down but ltc will live on regardless.
